TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit FeedOptions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Specifies the options associated with feed methods (enumeration operations) in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.remarks: Used to manage query and ReadFeed execution. Can use FeedOptions to set page size (MaxItemCount)

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Gets or sets the option for the current query in the Azure DocumentDB database service.

remarks.para: DisableRUPerMinuteUsage is used to enable/disable Request Units(RUs)/minute capacity to serve the query if regular provisioned RUs/second is exhausted.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users are enabled to send more than one request to execute the query in the Azure DocumentDB database service. More than one request is necessary if the query is not scoped to single partition key value.
Docs.value: Option is true if cross-partition query execution is enabled; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This option only applies to queries on documents and document attachments.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the option to enable low precision order by in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.value: The option to enable low-precision order by.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the option to enable scans on the queries which couldn't be served as indexing was opted out on the requested paths in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.value: Option is true if scan on queries is enabled; otherwise, false.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of items that can be buffered client side during parallel query execution in the Azure DocumentDB database service. A positive property value limits the number of buffered items to the set value. If it is set to less than 0, the system automatically decides the number of items to buffer.
Docs.value: The maximum count of items that can be buffered during parallel query execution.
Docs.remarks: This is only suggestive and cannot be abided by in certain cases.

example.code: var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaximumBufferSize = 10, MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 2 });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaximumBufferSize = 10, MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 2 });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaximumBufferSize = 10, MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 2 });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaximumBufferSize = 10, MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 2 });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaximumBufferSize = 10, MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 2 });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaximumBufferSize = 10, MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 2 });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaximumBufferSize = 10, MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 2 });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaximumBufferSize = 10, MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 2 });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaximumBufferSize = 10, MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 2 });

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of concurrent operations run client side during parallel query execution in the Azure DocumentDB database service. A positive property value limits the number of concurrent operations to the set value. If it is set to less than 0, the system automatically decides the number of concurrent operations to run.
Docs.value: The maximum number of concurrent operations during parallel execution. Defaults to 0.

example.code: var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 5});
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 5});
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 5});
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 5});
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 5});
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 5});
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 5});
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 5});
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 5});

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of items to be returned in the enumeration operation in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.value: The maximum number of items to be returned in the enumeration operation.
Docs.remarks: Used for query pagination. '-1' Used for dynamic page size.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the for the current request in the Azure DocumentDB database service.

remarks.para: Partition key is required when read documents or attachments feed in a partitioned collection. Specifically Partition key is required for : , and . Only documents in partitions containing the is returned in the result.

Docs.example:
The following example shows how to read a document feed in a partitioned collection using . The example assumes the collection is created with a on the 'country' property in all the documents.
await client.ReadDocumentFeedAsync( collection.SelfLink, new RequestOptions { PartitionKey = new PartitionKey("USA") } );

The following example shows how to read a document feed in a partitioned collection using . The example assumes the collection is created with a on the 'country' property in all the documents.
await client.ReadDocumentFeedAsync( collection.SelfLink, new RequestOptions { PartitionKey = new PartitionKey("USA") } );

await client.ReadDocumentFeedAsync( collection.SelfLink, new RequestOptions { PartitionKey = new PartitionKey("USA") } );

The following example shows how to read a document feed in a partitioned collection using . The example assumes the collection is created with a on the 'country' property in all the documents.
await client.ReadDocumentFeedAsync( collection.SelfLink, new RequestOptions { PartitionKey = new PartitionKey("USA") } );

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the partition key range id for the current request.

remarks.para: ReadFeed requests can use this to forward request to specific range. This is usefull in case of bulk export scenarios.

Docs.example:
The following example shows how to read a document feed in a partitioned collection from partition key range "20".
await client.ReadDocumentFeedAsync( collection.SelfLink, new RequestOptions { PartitionKeyRangeId = "20" } );

The following example shows how to read a document feed in a partitioned collection from partition key range "20".
await client.ReadDocumentFeedAsync( collection.SelfLink, new RequestOptions { PartitionKeyRangeId = "20" } );

The following example shows how to read a document feed in a partitioned collection from partition key range "20".
await client.ReadDocumentFeedAsync( collection.SelfLink, new RequestOptions { PartitionKeyRangeId = "20" } );

The following example shows how to read a document feed in a partitioned collection from partition key range "20".
await client.ReadDocumentFeedAsync( collection.SelfLink, new RequestOptions { PartitionKeyRangeId = "20" } );

The following example shows how to read a document feed in a partitioned collection from partition key range "20".
await client.ReadDocumentFeedAsync( collection.SelfLink, new RequestOptions { PartitionKeyRangeId = "20" } );

The following example shows how to read a document feed in a partitioned collection from partition key range "20".
await client.ReadDocumentFeedAsync( collection.SelfLink, new RequestOptions { PartitionKeyRangeId = "20" } );

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the request option for document query requests in the Azure DocumentDB database service.

remarks.para: PopulateQueryMetrics is used to enable/disable getting metrics relating to query execution on document query requests.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the request continuation token in the Azure DocumentDB database service.

example.code: // Resume query execution using the continuation from the previous query var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { RequestContinuation = prevQuery.ResponseContinuation });

// Resume query execution using the continuation from the previous query var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { RequestContinuation = prevQuery.ResponseContinuation });

// Resume query execution using the continuation from the previous query var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { RequestContinuation = prevQuery.ResponseContinuation });

// Resume query execution using the continuation from the previous query var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { RequestContinuation = prevQuery.ResponseContinuation });

// Resume query execution using the continuation from the previous query var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { RequestContinuation = prevQuery.ResponseContinuation });

// Resume query execution using the continuation from the previous query var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { RequestContinuation = prevQuery.ResponseContinuation });

// Resume query execution using the continuation from the previous query var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { RequestContinuation = prevQuery.ResponseContinuation });

// Resume query execution using the continuation from the previous query var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { RequestContinuation = prevQuery.ResponseContinuation });

// Resume query execution using the continuation from the previous query var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>(collectionLink, new FeedOptions { RequestContinuation = prevQuery.ResponseContinuation });

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the request option for document query requests in the Azure DocumentDB database service.

remarks.para: ResponseContinuationTokenLimitInKb is used to limit the length of continuation token in the query response. Valid values are >= 0.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the session token for use with session consistency in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.value: The session token for use with session consistency.
Docs.remarks: Useful for applications that are load balanced across multiple Microsoft.Azure.Documents.Client.DocumentClient instances. In this case, round-trip the token from end user to the application and then back to DocumentDB so that a session can be preserved across servers.

example.code: var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>( collectionLink, new FeedOptions { SessionToken = lastSessionToken });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>( collectionLink, new FeedOptions { SessionToken = lastSessionToken });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>( collectionLink, new FeedOptions { SessionToken = lastSessionToken });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>( collectionLink, new FeedOptions { SessionToken = lastSessionToken });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>( collectionLink, new FeedOptions { SessionToken = lastSessionToken });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>( collectionLink, new FeedOptions { SessionToken = lastSessionToken });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>( collectionLink, new FeedOptions { SessionToken = lastSessionToken });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>( collectionLink, new FeedOptions { SessionToken = lastSessionToken });
var queryable = client.CreateDocumentQuery<Book>( collectionLink, new FeedOptions { SessionToken = lastSessionToken });
